definition: each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
shield/(currency) Vietnamese dong/currency unit of several countries (Indonesian rupiah, Dutch gulden etc)

sentences.english: He denies that his prophecy is self-denying.
sentences.chinese: 他对于自己的预言是自相矛盾的说法予以了否定。

sentences.english: The book is a shapeless mass of contradictory rough drafts.
sentences.chinese: 那本书是一堆自相矛盾的草稿的汇编。

sentences.english: And his stance in nuclear negotiations frequently appears contradictory and confounding.
sentences.chinese: 还有他在核问题的谈判立场经常自相矛盾，左右摇摆。

sentences.english: Analyze the requirements carefully, and look for self-contradicting requirements.
sentences.chinese: 仔细分析需求，并找出自相矛盾的需求。

sentences.english: While this may seem like a paradox, it's not totally unexpected.
sentences.chinese: 虽然这看起来有些自相矛盾，但这并非完全是意外。

sentences.english: He says he’s tired of the challenger’s contradictory statements.
sentences.chinese: 他说他对手那些自相矛盾的词语令他感到腻烦。

sentences.english: Mr Benioff’s story is full of paradoxes.
sentences.chinese: 贝尼奥夫的传奇充满了自相矛盾。

sentences.english: But all of these seemed to be so self-contradictory.
sentences.chinese: 但是所有这一切似乎是那么自相矛盾的地方。

sentences.english: His answer to this question is inconsistent and self-contradictory.
sentences.chinese: 他对这个问题的回答前后不同，而且自相矛盾。

sentences.english: The Chinese statement itself OXYMORONIC& BETRAYS their true&cunning nature.
sentences.chinese: 中国的称述自相矛盾，背叛了他们狡猾的真实天性。

sentences.english: The first paradox for the visitor has to do with one's latitude of departure.
sentences.chinese: 第一点自相矛盾之处与到访者出发时的纬度有关。

sentences.english: It’s a paradox, one of the biggest ones in the world.
sentences.chinese: 这是自相矛盾的，也是这世界上最重要的事之一。

sentences.english: It’s possible that I seem to contradict myself in this essay.
sentences.chinese: 我在这篇随笔中似乎自相矛盾，这是可能的。

sentences.english: "Queried" a paper on "two kinds of life" view is self-contradictory.
sentences.chinese: 《质疑》一文对“两种生活”的看法是自相矛盾的。

definition: circular argument/logical error consisting of begging the question/Latin: petitio principii
to make a story or theory consistent/to give a plausible explanation/to plug the holes in one's story
apparently right but actually wrong; specious (idiom)
(idiom) to say one thing and do another
to twist words and force logic (idiom)/sophistry/loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument/shoving false arguments down people's throats
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
(of an argument, theory etc) full of flaws (idiom)
